text: Jesper Verlaat (born 4 June 1996) is a Dutch professional footballer who plays as a defender for side Waldhof Mannheim. Having come through the youth ranks of Werder Bremen, he began his professional career with the club's reserves. He is the son of former Dutch footballer Frank Verlaat, who also played for Bremen. ==Career== Verlaat, who can be mobilised both in midfield and in central defence, began his career at FC Oberneuland before moving to the youth academy of Admira Wacker in 2003. Subsequently, Verlaat played at Sturm Graz. When his parents relocated to Algarve, Portugal in 2007, Verlaat played for various Portuguese teams until Verlaat moved to Werder Bremen in summer 2012 after a trial with the U-17s.Stefan Freye: Werder verpflichtet Jesper Verlaat (Weser-Kurier on 12 August 2012, accessed on 7 November 2015) On 13 March 2015, Verlaat made his debut for Werder Bremen's reserves, coming on as a substitute for Onur Capin just before the end against TSV Havelse. In the summer he permanently became part of the second team, which had been promoted to the 3. Liga. He made his 3. Liga debut on 1 November 2015 as a substitute in the 29th minute in the 3–2 home win against Chemnitzer FC.Dritter Heimsieg in Folge: Bremen hält Anschluss kicker.de, accessed on 7 November 2015 Since then Verlaat became a regular player. His first goal for the second team came on 7 November 2015, during the 1–2 away defeat against Fortuna Köln.Fortunas Serie hält - Bremen verliert nach zwei Siegen wieder kicker.de, accessed on 7 November 2015 In May 2018, following Werder Bremen II's relegation from the 3. Liga, it was announced Verlaat would be one of ten players to leave the club. In June 2018, Verlaat joined 2. Bundesliga side SV Sandhausen on a two-year contract. Verlaat joined 3.
